com.ti.debug.engine.scripting

Class Flash

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ti.debug.engine.scripting.Flash

  • public class Flash
extends java.lang.Object
    This class encapsulates the flash programmer methods. An instance of this class is automatically created when a new session is opened.

    Note: Do not use this class for Flash operations on MSP430 devices; MSP430 does not currently support Flash specific operations or options at this time. Download Options for MSP430 can be accessed using the DebugSession.options class.

    // Create Environment and open a debug session
    ScriptingEnvironment env = new ScriptingEnvironment();
    DebugServer myServer = (DebugServer) env.getServer("DebugServer.1");
    DebugSession mySession = myServer.openSession("*", "*");

    ...

    // set which sectors to erase and then execute the erase operation
    // note: SECTORA, SECTORB, etc. are just examples, look up the exact string for your device using the mySession.flash.options.printOptions() API
    mySession.flash.options.setBoolean(SECTORA, true);
    mySession.flash.options.setBoolean(SECTORB, false);
    mySession.flash.options.setBoolean(SECTORC, true);
    mySession.flash.options.setBoolean(SECTORD, true);
    mySession.flash.options.setBoolean(SECTORE, false);
    mySession.flash.erase();

      Needs to be called before using the Multi-load feature to only erase the Flash on the first program load.
      void performOperation(java.lang.String opCode)
      Performs the Flash operation associated with the opCode.
      void programPassword()
      Programs the given password to flash.
      void startFrequencyTest()
      Start the frequency test to test the frequency on the target (using an oscilloscope).
      void unlock()
      Unlocks the flash if the user input password matches the one that was programmed
      Relevant properties for 28xx devices: FlashKey0, FlashKey1, etc.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateChecksum

        public void calculateChecksum()
                       throws ScriptingException
        Calculates the checksum on flash.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the calculateChecksum operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • depletionRecovery

        public void depletionRecovery()
                       throws ScriptingException
        Performs the Depletion Recovery operation.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the depletionRecovery operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • endFrequencyTest

        public void endFrequencyTest()
                      throws ScriptingException
        Ends the frequency test and halts the target. A ScriptingException is thrown if the endFrequencyTest operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • erase

        public void erase()
           throws ScriptingException
        Erases the selected sectors in flash.
        Relevant properties for 28xx devices: FlashSectorA, FlashSectorB, etc.
        Relevant properties for Stellaris devices: FlashEraseStartAddr, FlashEraseEndAddr, FlashEraseType
        Relevant properties for TMSx70 devices: FlashEraseSelection, FlashBank0Sector0, FlashBank0Sector1, etc.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the erase operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • getFlashChecksum

        public int getFlashChecksum()
                     throws ScriptingException
        Returns the calculated checksum on flash.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the calculateChecksum operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Returns:
        the calculated flash checksum
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • getOTPChecksum

        public int getOTPChecksum()
                   throws ScriptingException
        Returns the calculated OTP checksum on flash.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the calculateChecksum operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Returns:
        the calculated OTP checksum
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • isFlashSupported

        public boolean isFlashSupported()
        Determines if Flash programming is supported for the current device. Can be use at the start of the script to make sure device is supported.
        Returns:
        (boolean) true if flash programming is supported, false otherwise.

      • listSupportedOperations

        public void listSupportedOperations()
                             throws ScriptingException
        Outputs the supported flash opCodes that the current target supports. A ScriptingException is thrown if Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • lock

        public void lock()
          throws ScriptingException
        Locks the flash based on the password that was programmed. A ScriptingException is thrown if the lock operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • multiloadEnd

        public void multiloadEnd()
                  throws ScriptingException
        Needs to be called to finish the multi-load operation. The Flash manager will return to default mode (erase Flash based on user settings)
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • multiloadStart

        public void multiloadStart()
                    throws ScriptingException
        Needs to be called before using the Multi-load feature to only erase the Flash on the first program load. Once the Flash Manger receives this call, users will be free to call debugSession.memory.load() as many times as needed to write to the Flash
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • performOperation

        public void performOperation(java.lang.String opCode)
                      throws ScriptingException
        Performs the Flash operation associated with the opCode. A list of all available opCodes for the current device can be displayed by calling listSupportedOperations() A ScriptingException is thrown if the opCode is invalid or Flash is not supported for current device.
        Parameters:
        opCode - String operation code for the flash operation
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • programPassword

        public void programPassword()
                     throws ScriptingException
        Programs the given password to flash.
        Relevant properties for 28xx devices: FlashKey1, FlashKey2, etc.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the programPassword operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • startFrequencyTest

        public void startFrequencyTest()
                        throws ScriptingException
        Start the frequency test to test the frequency on the target (using an oscilloscope). A ScriptingException is thrown if the startFrequencyTest operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException

      • unlock

        public void unlock()
            throws ScriptingException
        Unlocks the flash if the user input password matches the one that was programmed
        Relevant properties for 28xx devices: FlashKey0, FlashKey1, etc.
        A ScriptingException is thrown if the unlock operation is not supported or Flash is not supported for current device
        Throws:
        ScriptingException
